We have a very successful one as part of Oracle. It is a pull system vs push, so employees log in (from home or work site) adn can print their pay stub.  We also went to required electronic deposits, which helped dramatically.

Yes.  The City of Painesville's system sends the pay stub to the employee at their chosen e-mail address.  We receive it on Wednesday prior to payday.   We are also requiring direct deposit.  Contact Bob Baetzel, HR Manager, at 440-392-5786 or bbaetzel@painesville.com .  Good luck.

answers.author: Mary Morrison
answers.text:
The City of Tacoma currently uses SAP NetWeaver ESS (Employee Self Service) portal to give employees the ability to view paystub and change bank detail information, view vacation/PTO quota balances, log TRIP data and view benefit enrollments to name a few options through ESS.  An Information Technology project is currently underway to upgrade SAP to version ECC 6.04 this summer.  Along with this upgrade, Employee Self Service functionality will also be enhanced.  One example of how the improved functionality of ESS will add to the capabilities of SAP is Interactive Forms by Adobe.  With this application, the City will be able to reproduce familiar-looking interactive forms via the ESS portal.  Employees will have an easier time adopting new electronic distribution processes such as electronic pay advices.  If you would like guidance through existing functionality of SAP ESS, please contact John Ching (information below), and he would be happy to provide more information.  
To help employees understand the process, the Information Technology Department offers a 3 hr training class which briefly touches on capabilities of ESS functionality. Additional information will be provided to employees to help with the proposed changes to the system. 
Contact information:
John KW Ching
John.ching@cityoftacoma.org
Payroll Division
Finance Department
City of Tacoma
(253)591-5860

author: Jonathan Palmer
text:
Cross posted from the ICMA group on LinkedIn.
Do any other municipalities utilize a payroll self service? How do you have it set up? Do employees log-in to a central website and access their paystubs? Are they emailed to employees personal email addresses? Any info you can provide would be helpful. Thanks!
title: Payroll Self-Service
